body:
> @kezhenxu94 skywalking-eye fails to handle some repos' license:
> 
> ```
> ERROR failed to identify the licenses of following packages (2):
> build.buf.protoc-gen-validate:pgv-java-stub
> build.buf.protoc-gen-validate:protoc-gen-validate 
> Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
> ```
> 
> https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/3342606435/jobs/5537555471

There is no licensing information from the perspective of maven dependency, so for now I'm afraid you have to apply the patch:

```diff
diff --git a/.licenserc.yaml b/.licenserc.yaml
index e7a33ff930..ec0af00052 100644
--- a/.licenserc.yaml
+++ b/.licenserc.yaml
@@ -119,3 +119,9 @@ dependency:
     - name: com.google.flatbuffers:flatbuffers-java
       version: 1.12.0
       license: Apache-2.0
+    - name: build.buf.protoc-gen-validate:pgv-java-stub
+      version: 0.6.13
+      license: Apache-2.0
+    - name: build.buf.protoc-gen-validate:protoc-gen-validate
+      version: 0.6.13
+      license: Apache-2.0
```

> @mikechengwei Hi, it is great to see you have interests. But, for this particular one, it is a kernel-level change, and we have assigned this to one of the PMC members @wankai123 to check and decide how to fix it.

Ok.

As you have marked this PR ready to review. Please reply or resolve the PR's comments from reviewers.

> As you have marked this PR ready to review. Please reply or resolve the PR's comments from reviewers.

I'm so sorry. 
I thought I have answered and didn't notice the "pending" tag.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28537230/198976239-bf35176f-75c1-4472-ac1f-5ebc47c0beb9.png)

> What do you mean `more reasonable`? `increase` is usually used for a counter which keeps growing.

Because so far gc_time is reported by MeterService every 20s but not reported right after gc.
I'm goint to make gc_time accumulatable to get average time consumption for gc within 1 minute.
Is this okay?

> Are these GC counters? It feels increasing always like so.

Nope. It's the number of objects for each generation.
Like Java, the objects from older generations are more infrequently to be checked if it can be deleted.

I thought I have answered and didn't notice the "pending" tag. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28537230/198976239-bf35176f-75c1-4472-ac1f-5ebc47c0beb9.png) > > Pending means you should submit it through `comment` once of all Thanks!
I left you some messages on slack.

> @pg-yang Could you check, are peer and broker addr of Kafka and ActiveMQ same? And use the cluster addr list?

Kafka uses addr  list  as broker tag value , which reads from configuration properties `bootstrap.servers` , it's correct .

AcviteMQ is complex ,  ActiveMQ  plugin read addr through `session.getConnection().getTransport().getRemoteAddress()` .
 The method  `getRemoteAddress` in  `FailoverTransport` (an  implementation of `Transport`) means get current server address  . In a word , AcviteMQ plugin couldn't get cluster addr  list in some case

> Kafka uses addr list as broker tag value , which reads from configuration properties bootstrap.servers , it's correct .

This is a good practice. Could you try to consistent these plugins? Read the broker addr list from the initialization configuration?
Yes , I would try to fix it . and check other plugins
`peer` is used for Topology build, so, how does Kafka's span peer look like? How about we use `peer` as a service like how we do for the virtual database? And leave broker_addr as they are for now?

> `peer` is used for Topology build, so, how does Kafka's span peer look like? How about we use `peer` as a service like how we do for the virtual database? And leave broker_addr as they are for now?

Both of peer (at producer side ) and broker tag are addr list   , for example kafka , nats ,rabbit ,
I choose broker tag as service name  because EntrySpan (at  consumer side ) don't have peer  ,  and  I could read server address through consistent way `broker tag`  , whether at consumer side or producer side

`virtual database` only have ExitSpan , it's different with mq , right ?

> I choose broker tag as service name because EntrySpan (at consumer side ) don't have peer , and I could read server address through consistent way broker tag , whether at consumer side or producer side

Actually, the consumer side should have the peer for MQ(only). Otherwise, there is no suitable topology.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/4adc05f89c5506541f6c0817db90238c96e1b5d3/oap-server/analyzer/agent-analyzer/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/analyzer/provider/trace/parser/listener/RPCAnalysisListener.java#L102-L113
OK , I would check the peer at consumer side , and use peer as service  name  if it's suitable .
cc @wankai123 @tristaZero @terrymanu

If you have finished the development, please let me know. @mrproliu

One E2E test case seems to be stuck in a cache retrieval step :0
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/3368331192/jobs/5588961894

Maybe we should tune the segment download timeout down a bit https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/workarounds.md#cache-segment-restore-timeout

> One E2E test case seems to be stuck in a cache retrieval step :0 https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/3368331192/jobs/5588961894
> 
> Maybe we should tune the segment download timeout down a bit https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/workarounds.md#cache-segment-restore-timeout

It makes sense. FYI @kezhenxu94

> Default value of this timeout is 60 minutes and can be customized by specifying an environment variable named SEGMENT_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_MINS with timeout value in minutes.

60 minutes is too long in my opinion. Usually if it takes that long it means something wrong in GitHub Actions and I would expect it to fail as soon as possible.

> > Default value of this timeout is 60 minutes and can be customized by specifying an environment variable named SEGMENT_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_MINS with timeout value in minutes.
> 
> 60 minutes is too long in my opinion. Usually if it takes that long it means something wrong in GitHub Actions and I would expect it to fail as soon as possible.

I guess somewhere around 5 minutes should be sufficient for our case? I can make a pr later.
@kezhenxu94 @pg-yang Do we have cases in the showcase about Kafka?

Not now
Should we consider adding it? Is the resource cost reasonable?

> Should we consider adding it? Is the resource cost reasonable?

It's not worthwhile to waste too many resource to fill this dashboard, but if we can manage to only use say at most 2CPU and 2G to set this up, I think we can do this.

Not sure whether 2CPU and 2G is enough to run the message queue, maybe we can try Pulsar standalone mode.
Kafka would take more resource , and  I didn't  know Pulsar is MQ , so maybe I should confirm whether Pulsar plugin  follows  virtual MQ  specification

Yes, pulsar is a MQ. 

If Kafka costs too much, maybe activeMQ? This is not a hard requirement though.

I'd like to use activeMQ  . Although sometimes  it couldn't record complete server addresses , it's enough for showcase   .

> Although sometimes it couldn't record complete server addresses 

What do you mean by `sometimes`? I think the agent's behavior is predictable. `Sometimes` seems scary.

> AcviteMQ is complex , ActiveMQ plugin read addr through session.getConnection().getTransport().getRemoteAddress() .
The method getRemoteAddress in FailoverTransport (an implementation of Transport) means get current server address . In a word , AcviteMQ plugin couldn't get cluster addr list in some case

Here  . Our test case only include  common case  , if the test  scenario involves   `FailoverTransport` , the agent couldn't  record complete addresses

I see. You mean that plugin is not robust. That is fine, once you could confirm this would not cause
1. Topology shows some strange nodes, such as a node named `null` or a random IP
2. Cause tracing context leak, and we would not have trace and metric to show anymore.

The one thing that needs to be fixed is this, 

```
For the screenshot, the biggest issue is, SampleFamily should have a concept of the group for the bulk. We should not face one SampleFamily have metrics belonging to the same metric and labels, but with multiple timestamps.

Otherwise, the aggregation result would be strange and unpredictable.

What's your Dockerfile, or build steps?

FROM php:7.3-fpm-alpine

RUN set -ex \
    && echo "https://mirrors.aliyun.com/alpine/edge/main" > /etc/apk/repositories \
    && echo "https://mirrors.aliyun.com/alpine/edge/community" >> /etc/apk/repositories \
    && echo "https://mirrors.aliyun.com/alpine/edge/testing" >> /etc/apk/repositories \
    && apk add --update --no-cache --virtual .build-deps1 g++ autoconf make cargo clang protobuf \
    && apk add --update --no-cache --virtual .build-deps2 git libevent-dev openssl-dev jpeg-dev freetype-dev libpng-dev libzip-dev libwebp-dev libmcrypt-dev libxml2-dev \
    && docker-php-ext-install pcntl posix pdo_mysql soap sockets \
    && docker-php-ext-configure gd --with-webp=/usr/include/webp --with-jpeg=/usr/include --with-freetype=/usr/include/freetype2/ \
    && docker-php-ext-install -j$(nproc) gd \
	&& pecl install redis zip apcu mcrypt event skywalking_agent \
	&& docker-php-ext-enable redis zip apcu mcrypt event skywalking_agent \
	&& apk del .build-deps1

CMD ["php-fpm"]

Got it.

A brief change list:

- Rename all general `H2XXXX` to `JDBCXXXX` and move them to `jdbc/common` package for general uses of JDBC-compatible storages.
- Unify the configurations of JDBC storages by adding `JDBCStorageConfig`, if specific storage needs new configurations, they can extend `JDBCStorageConfig`, example like `MySQLShardingStorageConfig`.
- Remove mounting config files in `test/e2e-v2/script/shardingsphere-proxy/base-compose.yml`, this is general base docker-compose.yaml and the config files should be mounted in where it's used, like when testing mysql we should mount mysql config files in the mysql case folder, and mount postgresql config files in postgresql folder.
- Remove configuratioin `h2.driver: ${SW_STORAGE_H2_DRIVER:org.h2.jdbcx.JdbcDataSource}`, this is not needed as the driver name can be inferred from the URL `jdbc:h2`, also use the same `properties` configuration style as other JDBC storages used.

After some discussion, we noticed this would cost too much as it is not just exporting an image, it has to include html/js with data. There is no real case why users can't use our UI but an exported page. 

Close for now.

Hi, thanks for proposing.
We have docker, helm, and k8s operator deployment in separate repository.
I would like to ask, is this going to be another kind of deployment description?
Yes it's driven by nomad jobs and it's another container orchestration which is much much smaller than k8s

https://www.nomadproject.io/ 

If you need any help i would really like to help

If it is separated, then we need at least on dev mail list, because we need another repository for it.
Would you like to subscribe to dev mail list and propose this officially?

This is one you could ref 

https://lists.apache.org/list?dev@skywalking.apache.org:lte=3M:Propose%20to%20create%20SkyWalking%20PHP%20agent%20project

Notice, this was proposed by maintainer, so, it was easy to be approved.

Your proposal may need to explain why and whether nomad is widely used, whether this is easy to keep being well maintained like other sub projects.
Don't use upstream to test. This is a spam.
@marcingrzejszczak Do we expect some changes for this? Or it is still compatible?

Hey, I didn't have time to do any work on this since yesterday we've released 1.10.0 GA of micrometer. We need to do some house keeping first (add missing docs etc.) and then I'll be able to spend some time on this.
I am just checking whether we still need to keep tracking this. Thanks for the update.

First of all, you should make sure the title is correct and complete when you submit anything to a community.

DMSQL is a commercial product of IBM. It is not licensed for us to do so.

Sorry, DMSQL is a domestic databaseï¼ŒDamon database management system is a high-performance database management system with completely independent intellectual property rights launched by Damon, which is called DM for shortï¼ŒIn recent years, domestic databases have been used more and more widely, which is a trend

It is also a commercial product.
Nothing different from license perspective.
There is nothing about a trend in this discussion.
Okay! Thank you for your communication which has benefited me a lot.
Another framework option is https://github.com/uber-go/fx

I don't believe struts one is still active. Unless you are going to contribute, feel free to do.
We don't encourage committer team to spend time on this.
Hahaha, Struts 1 is rarely used, but it still exists. Now that I have made it, I am still willing to make a little contribution to the open source community

I would recommend you to open the project on your own name, rather than to upstream.
Because we have to ask plugin test to cover popular versions, but there is no version for it to be active any more.
